summary:
• A failed coup attempt occurred in Bolivia.
• The event lasted approximately 75 seconds.
• Details surrounding the incident remain unclear.

• Two former Chinese defense ministers were expelled from the Communist Party due to corruption and abuse of power.
• The expulsion is seen as a significant move by the party against high-ranking officials accused of wrongdoing.
• The decision highlights the ongoing efforts to root out corruption within the government and military ranks in China.

• Gaza evacuees in Egypt live in difficult conditions
• They face uncertainty about their future and lack support from authorities
• Their living situation is precarious and uncertain

• The far-right party is leading in the elections and aiming for a majority
• Armed men stormed a wedding killing one person
• Voters punished Macron's centrists and boosted the far-right party in polls

• The US Department of Homeland Security has extended Temporary Protected Status (TPS) for Haitian nationals in the United States.
• This decision aims to ensure that Haitians can continue living safely in the US without fear of deportation during ongoing political instability at home.
• TPS allows Haitian citizens who were already residing in the US when it was granted to remain legally until conditions improve in their homeland.

• Heavy monsoon rains cause severe damage to New Delhi's airport.
• The airport's roof collapses due to excessive rainfall, resulting in structural failure.
• At least one person is killed as vehicles beneath the collapsed roof are crushed.

• Iran's presidential election proceeds with a runoff due to low voter turnout.
• The runoff pits a reformist candidate against a conservative one.
• Voting hours have been extended for the snap election due to low participation.

• Tensions escalate between Israel and Lebanon
• US pushes for a deal to avoid conflict
• Potential for war looms if agreement cannot be reached

• At least 18 people were killed by suspected female suicide bombers in Nigeria.
• The bombings occurred in an unspecified location within the country.
• No further details on casualties or injuries have been reported.

• A family escapes North Korea by crossing the open sea in a rickety boat.
• The family faces numerous challenges during their perilous journey.
• They finally reach safety after overcoming incredible obstacles.

• Parents lock themselves in cells to help their children overcome anxiety or depression.
• This "happiness factory" is designed to provide emotional support to young people struggling with mental health issues.
• By staying with their children, parents hope to foster a sense of security and comfort during difficult times.

• Williams scores stunning goal
• Spain defeats Georgia in match
• Sets up quarter-final against Germany

• A woman has identified her sister as one of the refugees captured in a video from Sudan.
• The identification was made through a video of refugees caught up in Sudan's conflict.
• The reunion brings hope to both women after being separated during the conflict.

• President Zelensky has called for increased supplies of long-range weapons.
• A weekend was held in Kharkiv with activities including beach, table tennis, and poetry jams despite ongoing bombing by Russia.
• The city is still under attack from Russia.

• Allies defend Biden against age concerns due to poll results.
• The first presidential debate between Biden and Trump has taken place, with various reactions and analysis emerging.
• Airlines have apologized for leaving passengers in wheelchairs on the tarmac at an airport terminal.
